meanings.definition: An irritating or obnoxious person or animal.
meanings.sent1: The noisy varmints in the park kept disturbing the peace.
meanings.sent2: The neighbor's dog barking all night was a real varmint.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous varmints played a prank on their teacher.
meanings.sent4: Her little brother was a varmint, always causing trouble.
meanings.sent5: The pesky varmints scurried around the yard, causing chaos.

meanings.definition: Small animals considered to be pests or nuisances, such as rodents or insects.
meanings.sent1: The farmer set traps to catch the varmints destroying his crops.
meanings.sent2: The city hired an exterminator to get rid of the varmints infesting the buildings.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous varmints raided the picnic basket and stole all the food.
meanings.sent4: The garden was overrun by varmints, eating all the vegetables in sight.
meanings.sent5: The pesky varmints burrowed under the house, causing damage to the foundation.
